summary: Metallica is an American heavy metal band formed in 1981 by James Hetfield and Lars Ulrich. Based in San Francisco, they are known for their fast, aggressive music and are one of the "big four" thrash metal bands. The current lineup includes Hetfield, Ulrich, Kirk Hammett, and Robert Trujillo. Their third album, "Master of Puppets" (1986), brought them commercial success. Later, the album "Metallica" (1991) appealed to a mainstream audience. They've won ten Grammy Awards and sold over 125 million albums worldwide. Metallica was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2009.
title: Metallica
